content.text: To maintain Eduversal Partner Schools' status as approved Cambridge Assessment International Education Centres, ensure examination integrity, deliver high-quality Cambridge curriculum and assessments, and comply with all Cambridge policies and procedures.

A Cambridge Centre is a school or institution approved by Cambridge Assessment International Education to deliver Cambridge curriculum, register students for examinations, administer exams under secure conditions, and receive official certificates.

content.title: Centre Registration Process
items: Eligibility Assessment: Valid operational license, adequate facilities, qualified staff, commitment to standards.
Application Submission: Complete application via Cambridge International Direct, provide school details, nominate key roles, pay application fee.
Cambridge Review: Review of application, possible site visit, approval typically takes 4-8 weeks.
Centre Approval: Upon approval, receive Centre number and login credentials.

content.text: Existing Centres must maintain registration and comply with annual requirements.

content.title: Annual Centre Declaration Requirements
items: Ensure facilities are adequate for exam administration.

content.text: Each Centre must designate individuals responsible for examination integrity and quality assurance.

content.title: Centre Head Responsibilities
items: Approve student registrations and exam entries.
Liaise with Cambridge on Centre matters.

content.title: Exams Officer Responsibilities
items: Coordinate exam entries and submit to Cambridge.
Order secure exam materials and schedule exam timetable.
Train invigilators and communicate exam schedules.

content.title: Quality Nominee Responsibilities
items: Monitor teaching quality and curriculum coverage.
Review student work for alignment with Cambridge expectations.

content.text: Eduversal Partner Schools deliver the Cambridge curriculum across multiple stages tailored to student age and progression.
Cambridge offers two main examination series per year.

content.title: May/June Series
items: Exam Period: Late April to Early June.

content.title: October/November Series
items: Exam Period: Late October to Late November.

content.title: Steps for Examination Entry
steps: Step 1: Student Subject Selection (Term before exams).
Step 2: Exam Entries Submission (8-10 weeks before exams).
Step 3: Timetable Preparation (6-8 weeks before exams).

subsections.title: Secure Storage and Exam Materials Management

content.text: Exam papers are confidential until the official start time of the exam.

content.title: Secure Storage Requirements
items: Lockable safe or strong room dedicated to exam materials.
Limited access to Exams Officer and Centre Head only.
Access log maintained throughout exam period.

content.text: Ensure exams are conducted fairly and securely.

content.title: Exam Conduct Rules
items: Students must arrive 15 minutes before Key Time.
No communication with other students once exam begins.

content.text: Cambridge provides fair access to exams for students with disabilities or learning differences.

content.title: Application Process for Access Arrangements
steps: Collect documentation at least 6 months before exams.
Submit application to Cambridge 3-4 months before exams.

content.text: Any action that compromises exam integrity or gives unfair advantage.

content.title: Types of Malpractice
items: Centre malpractice: opening papers early, inadequate security.

content.title: Reporting Obligation
steps: Report all suspected malpractice to Cambridge within 7 days.

content.title: Traditional Paper-Based Marking Process
steps: Collect scripts after exam and verify attendance.
Package scripts by subject and dispatch to Cambridge.

content.title: e-Marking Process
steps: Scan scripts and upload to Cambridge within 48 hours.

content.text: Results are released at specific times based on the exam series.

content.title: Certificate Issuance
items: Certificates dispatched approximately 3 months after results.
School holds presentation ceremony for students.

content.text: Ensure assessment practices align with Cambridge standards.

content.title: Internal Moderation Process
steps: Teacher assesses student work using Cambridge criteria.
Internal moderation by department head or experienced teacher.
Submit marks to Cambridge via International Direct.

content.text: Support teachers in delivering high-quality Cambridge curriculum.

content.title: Available Courses
items: Cambridge International Certificate in Teaching and Learning.

content.text: Recognition program for schools demonstrating excellence in Cambridge education.

content.title: Key Cambridge Policies
items: Data Protection: Secure handling of student data.
Marketing: Accurate representation of Cambridge relationship.

content.title: Annual Compliance Checklist
items: Update Centre details in Cambridge International Direct.

content.text: Cambridge may conduct inspections to ensure compliance with standards.
